p: Emerging infectious diseases (EIDs) continue to represent a significant public health threat, as illustrated by the 2009 H1N1 influenza pandemic and the 2003 severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) epidemic. Of particular concern are the 60%+ of EIDs of zoonotic origin [1], [2]. In addition to influenza and SARS [3], notable examples include hantaviruses [4], Nipah and Hendra viruses [5] and HIV [6].
